Abbreviation.description: redirect from an acronym (often spoken as a single word, e.g. POTUS)
redirect from a Bluebook standardized abbreviation
redirect from an initialism to its expanded form (often pronounced letter-by-letter, e.g. AGF)
redirect from an ISO 4 publication title abbreviation
redirect from a title that is a letter–word combination to a topic that describes or explains the combination
redirect from MathSciNet publication title abbreviation to the unabbreviated title
redirect from a numeronym to a related topic (number-based word, e.g. K9)
redirect from a NLM publication title abbreviation to the unabbreviated title
redirect from a systematic name to a more commonly used name

Capitalisation.description: redirect from a title with another method of capitalisation

Grammar & punctuation.description: redirect from a modification of the target"s title, such as with words rearranged
redirect from a plural word to the singular equivalent or from a singular noun to its plural form

Parts of speech.description: redirect from an adjective (word or phrase that describes a noun)
redirect from an adverb or adverbial phrase, which modifies a verb, an adjective or another adverb
redirect from a common noun (person, place, or thing)
redirect from a gerung–a verb that ends in "ing" that functions as a noun
redirect from a proper noun–a noun that begins with an uppercase letter
redirect from an English-language verb or verb phrase

Spelling.description: redirect from a title with a different spelling, punctuation, or hyphenation
redirect from an alternative English transliteration to a more common variation
redirect from an alternative English transliteration to a more common variation
redirect from a term in American English spelling to an alternate spelling variation
redirect from a title in only basic ASCII to the formal title, with differences that are not diacritical marks or ligatures or vise versa
redirect from a term in British English spelling to an alternate spelling variation
redirect from a page name that has diacritical marks (accents, umlauts, etc.) or vise versa
redirect from a page name that has ligatures to one without (e.g. Æ or æ) or vise versa
redirect from a misspelling or typographical error
redirect from a stylized article title

General.description: redirect from or to a title in another language

subgroup.name: altLangFrom
subgroup.label: From language (two-letter code):
subgroup.tooltip: Enter the two-letter code of the language the redirect name is in; such as en for English, de for German

subgroup.name: altLangTo
subgroup.label: To language (two-letter code):
subgroup.tooltip: Enter the two-letter code of the language the target name is in; such as en for English, de for German

subgroup.name: altLangInfo
subgroup.label: For a list of language codes, see WP:Template_messages/Redirect_language_codes

General.description: redirect from a title that is another name, a pseudonym, a nickname, or a synonym
redirect from an ambiguous sort name to a page or list that disambiguates it
redirect from a page that is an antonym or opposite of the target page
redirect from an eponym
redirect from a former name or working title no longer known by that name
redirect from a unique (alpha-)numerical identifier (like an EAN) to an article discussing that particular class of identifiers in mainspace
R from incomplete name
redirect from an erroneus name that is unsuitable as a title
redirect from a less specific title to a more specific, less general one
redirect from a more complete title
redirect from a more specific title to a less specific, more general one
redirect from a title that is a non-neutral, perhaps pejorative, controversial or offensive word, phrase or name
redirect from a title that includes the mathematical symbol of a number (or numbers) to an article with the word form of the number
redirect from a title in Roman numerals, to a title in Arabic numerals
redirect from a portmanteau to a related topic, such as the expansion of the portmanteau.
redirect from a title that is a shortened form of a person"s full name, a book title, or other more complete title
redirect from the target"s sort name, such as beginning with their surname rather than given name
redirect from a semantic synonym of the target page title
redirect from a page name that does not have diacritical marks (accents, umlauts, etc.)

People.description: redirect from a person"s birth name to a more common name
redirect from a person"s given name
redirect from one person"s name to a biographical article that includes this person along with one or more other persons
redirect from a person"s married name to that person"s more notable name when appropriate
redirect from a person"s name preceded or followed by a title to the name with no title or with the title in parentheses
redirect from a person or persons to a related article
redirect from an individual"s personal name to an article titled with their professional or other better known moniker
redirect from a title that is a surname

Technical.description: redirect from a title that is an ATC code to an article about a pharmaceutical drug
redirect from a title that is an ATCvet code to an article about a veterinary drug
redirect from a CAS Registry Number to its subject"s article in mainspace
redirect from a chemical/molecular formula to its systematic (technical) or trivial name
redirect from a citation identifier (e.g. ISBN)
redirect from a code that has no distinctive category to which it may be sorted
redirect from a DOI prefix to the associated registrant (typically a publisher or imprint)
redirect from (or to) the trade name of a drug to (or from) the international nonproprietary name (INN)
redirect from an E number
redirect from an E2 symmetry to an article section of a Euclidean tiling on its symmetry
redirect from a title that is a filename of the target
redirect from a title that is a file extension (such as .svg and .txt)
redirect from a Human Genome Organisation (HUGO) symbol for a gene to an article about the gene
edirect from an H2 symmetry to a section of an article about a hyperbolic tiling on its symmetry
redirect from a Java package name, class, or interface, to the software project or language feature that provides that package, or the computer science concept that it implements
redirect from a mathematical symbol or expression to a target article about the symbol or expression
redirect from a manufacturer"s designation to a more common military or commercial designation of an aircraft, vehicle, or other item
redirect from a NATO reporting name to the official designation of Soviet, Russian or Chinese military equipment
redirect from an S2 symmetry to an article or section of an article of a spherical polyhedron on its symmetry
redirect from a stock symbol to the company it represents on a stock exchange
redirect from a symbol to the meaning of the symbol or to a related topic
redirect from a more technical name to a common name or vise versa
redirect from a trademark to a more common stylisation or to the owner of the trademark
redirect from a title that is a US military aircraft designator to an article about the corresponding aircraft or missile
redirect from a variant military designation to the parent type of an aircraft, vehicle, or other item

Organisms.description: redirect from one or more animals to a related main topic that describes the animal(s)
redirect from the common name to the scientific name or vise versa
redirect from an alternative scientific name to the accepted scientific name
redirect from the only lower-ranking member of a monotypic taxon to its monotypic taxon or vise versa
redirect from a plant-related title that potentially could be expanded into an article
redirect from a title related to a living organism that potentially could be expanded into an article

Geography.description: redirect from a title that is a country calling code to its associated telephone/country article
redirect from an article title related to a Canadian settlement
redirect from a geographic location that uses the format 'city, province'
redirect from a geographic location that uses the format 'city, state'
redirect from a title for a former Swiss municipality to the municipality into which it was incorporated
redirect from a highway page title that may be a topic more detailed than the target page
redirect from the format '(highway) in (region)' to the (highway) article
redirect from the format '(highway) in (region)' to the (highway) article, without possibilites
redirect from a London place name to an article about that place
redirect from the specific name to the briefer name
redirect from a geographic location that includes extraneous identifiers such as the county or region of a city
redirect from a postal code to its assigned geographic area
redirect from a postal abbreviation to its associated city, state or other geographic entity
redirect from a numbered road that is insufficiently notable for an independent article to a list of roads that covers the route
redirect from a title in the form '[name of municipality](space)[two-letter abbreviation for canton]'
This is a redirect from a title in the form '[name of municipality]space[(name of canton)]'
redirect from a title in the form '[name of municipality], Switzerland'
redirect from a telephone number to a related topic, such as the company that can be reached there
redirect from a title that is a UN/LOCODE geographic code to an article or page associated with that code
redirect from a US postal abbreviation to its associated municipality
redirect from a United Kingdom postcode (postal code) to its assigned geographic area

Other.description: redirect from a legal case citation
redirect from the initialism (usually Greek letter Unicode symbols) for a Greek letter organization (sorority, fraternity, honor society, etc.)
redirect from a title that is an IMO number to an article about the corresponding ship, ship owner or management company
from a publisher"s imprint to a related article that gives information about the imprint
redirect from the name of a former company to a successor company
a redirect from the title of a railroad that is correct, but uses an ampersand (&) in place of the word 'and'
redirect from a term in South Indian spelling to an alternate spelling variation
redirect from a Twitter username to its subject"s article in mainspace. Every redirect title in this category must begin with an '@'
redirect from the Wade–Giles spelling of a Chinese word or name to the Pinyin or other preferred spelling

Navigation.description: redirect from a topic that does not have its own page to an anchored part of a page on the subject
redirect from an alternative title for another redirect

subgroup.name: doubleRedirectTarget
subgroup.label: Redirect target name
subgroup.tooltip: Enter the page this redirect would target if the page wasn"t also a redirect

Navigation.description: redirect from a category that is used as a navigational aid to the target category
redirect from a term that denotes the inhabitants of a target place
redirect of a wikilink created from EXIF, XMP, or other information (i.e. the 'metadata' section on some image description pages)
redirect from a title that is intended to make it easier to get to the target page
redirect from a highly-transcluded redirect to a template
redirect to a list which contains brief descriptions of subjects not notable enough to have separate articles
redirect from a title that is mentioned in a hatnote at the redirect target
redirect from an alias/shortcut (usually), or from a redirect that is the result of a page move/rename
redirect from a technically restricted page name to a page titled as closely as possible to the actual and true subject name
similar to {{R to list entry}}, but when list is organized in sections, such as list of characters in a fictional universe
redirect from a template shortcut or title that may have been moved (renamed) or merged to the target stub template
redirect from an rcat that is for test purposes only

Disambiguation.description: redirect from an ambiguous page name to a page that disambiguates it. This template should never appear on a page that has '(disambiguation)' in its title, use R to disambiguation page instead
redirect from a page name that is too ambiguous to be the title of an article and should redirect to an appropriate disambiguation page
redirect from a page name with incorrect disambiguation due to an error or previous editorial misconception
redirect from a page name with an alternative disambiguation qualifier
redirect from a page name with parenthetical disambiguation
redirect from a page name that has an unneeded disambiguation qualifier

Merge, duplicate & move.description: redirect from a page in the draft namespace (drafts) to an article in mainspace
redirect to a similar article in order to preserve its edit history
redirect from a page containing substantive page history, kept to preserve content and attributions
redirect from a page that has been moved/renamed
redirect from a merged page in order to preserve its edit history
edirect from a shortcut or the result of a page move/rename to a userbox template
redirect from a user warning template shortcut or convenience redirect to a user warning template
redirect from a page that was from a historic version of this Wikipedia project

Namespace.description: redirect from a talk page in any talk namespace to a corresponding page that is more heavily watched
redirect from a page outside the category namespace to a category page
redirect from a page in the draft namespace to an article in mainspace
redirect from any page inside or outside of help namespace to a page in that namespace
redirect from a page outside the main-article namespace to an article in mainspace
redirect from any page inside or outside of portal space to a page in that namespace
redirect from any page inside or outside of project (Wikipedia: or WP:) space to any page in the project namespace
redirect from a page outside any and all of the talk namespaces to a talk page
redirect from a page outside the template namespace to a template page
redirect from a page outside the user namespace to a user page (not to a user talk page)

General.description: redirect from a brand name to a generic name
redirect from a book title to a more general, relevant article
redirect from a film title that is a subtopic of the redirect target or a title in an alternative language that has been produced in that language
redirect from a title that potentially could be expanded into a new article or other type of associated page
redirect from a trade or professional journal article to a more general, relevant Wikipedia article
redirect from a name of an internet meme or other pop culture phenomenon that is a subtopic of the redirect target
redirect from a creative work to a related topic such as the author/artist, publisher, or a subject related to the work
redirect from a television episode title to a related work or lists of episodes
redirect from a title of television program, television series or web series that is a subtopic of the redirect target.

Fiction.description: redirect from a fictional character to a related fictional work or list of characters
redirect from a fictional element (such as an object or concept) to a related fictional work or list of similar elements
redirect from a fictional location or setting to a related fictional work or list of places
redirect from an alternative article title of a Middle-earth related topic
redirect from an alternative article title of a Middle-earth related topic
redirect from a page on the same or very similar subject matter related to the Middle-earth legendarium
redirect from a former name or working title of a Middle-earth related topic
redirect from the name of a Middle-earth 'minor topic' to a list article
redirect from the name of a Middle-earth 'minor topic' to a section
redirect from the name of a Middle-earth topic which currently redirects to a section or to an entry in a list or other article, and which may be expandable into a separate article
redirect from essentially the same Middle-earth page name that does not have diacritical marks

Music.description: redirect from an album to a related topic such as the recording artist or a list of albums
redirect from a cover version of a song to the article about the original song
redirect from a lyric to a song or other source that describes the lyric
redirect from a song title to a more general, relevant article

Comics.description: redirect from a comics-related title that potentially could be expanded into an article

redirect from a comics title that was merged into the target article
redirect to a title that complies with the Wikipedia naming conventions for comics-related articles
redirect from a word, phrase, concept, character, story or item to a comics title that is related in some way.
redirect from a comics-related subject that does not have its own page to an article section that covers the subject

redirect to an article without any mention of the redirected word or phrase
redirect from a bus route

redirect from a New York City bus route
redirect from a year to the decade article

redirect from a top-level domain to an article about a website (or the company that hosts it) that is more often referred to

redirect from the topic of a list to the equivalent list
redirect from a phrase to a more general relevant article covering the topic
redirect from a military designation to a more common civilian or manufacturer"s designation of an aircraft, vehicle, or other item
redirect from a title that is the name of a product or service to a more general, relevant article
redirect from a quotation to its best-known source
redirect to an article about a similar topic
redirect from a related word
redirect from the name of a relative of a person to the article about the person
redirect from a slogan (or motto) to an article or section of an article about the slogan
redirect from the name of a person"s spouse or former spouse to the article about the person

redirect from a school article that had very little information

redirect from a title that is a subtopic of the target article

redirect from an emoji to an article describing the depicted concept or the emoji itself

With possibilities.description: redirect from a specific title to a more general, less detailed article (something which can and should be expanded)
